verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto Joshua, Fear not, neither be thou dismayed: take all the people of war with thee, and arise, go up to Ai: see, I have given into thy hand the king of Ai, and his people, and his city, and his land:
verses.web: LORD said to Joshua, “Don’t be afraid, and don’t be dismayed. Take all the warriors with you, and arise, go up to Ai. Behold, I have given into your hand the king of Ai, with his people, his city, and his land.
verses.ct: The LORD told Joshua, "Don't be afraid, and don't lose heart. Gather all your fighting men and march up to Ai. I am handing over the king of Ai to you — his people, his city, and his land.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt do to Ai and her king as thou didst unto Jericho and her king: only the spoil thereof, and the cattle thereof, shall ye take for a prey unto yourselves: lay thee an ambush for the city behind it.
verses.web: You shall do to Ai and her king as you did to Jericho and her king, except you shall take its goods and its livestock for yourselves. Set an ambush for the city behind it.”
verses.ct: "Do to Ai and its king what you did to Jericho and its king, except this time you may keep the plunder and livestock for yourselves. Set up an ambush behind the city."

verses.kjv: So Joshua arose, and all the people of war, to go up against Ai: and Joshua chose out thirty thousand mighty men of valour, and sent them away by night.
verses.web: So Joshua arose, with all the warriors, to go up to Ai. Joshua chose thirty thousand men, the mighty men of valor, and sent them out by night.
verses.ct: So Joshua and all his warriors prepared to attack Ai. He handpicked 30,000 of his best fighting men and sent them out under cover of darkness.

verses.kjv: And he commanded them, saying, Behold, ye shall lie in wait against the city, even behind the city: go not very far from the city, but be ye all ready:
verses.web: He commanded them, saying, “Behold, you shall lie in ambush against the city, behind the city. Don’t go very far from the city, but all of you be ready.
verses.ct: He gave them these orders: "Hide in ambush behind the city. Stay close — don't go too far — and be ready to move at any moment.

verses.kjv: And I, and all the people that are with me, will approach unto the city: and it shall come to pass, when they come out against us, as at the first, that we will flee before them,
verses.web: I and all the people who are with me will approach the city. It shall happen, when they come out against us, as at the first, that we will flee before them.
verses.ct: "I'll lead the rest of the army toward the city. When the men of Ai come out to fight us like they did before, we'll turn and run from them.

verses.kjv: (For they will come out after us) till we have drawn them from the city; for they will say, They flee before us, as at the first: therefore we will flee before them.
verses.web: They will come out after us until we have drawn them away from the city; for they will say, ‘They flee before us, like the first time.’ So we will flee before them,
verses.ct: "They'll chase after us, thinking, 'They're running away just like last time!' We'll keep retreating to draw them away from the city.

verses.kjv: Then ye shall rise up from the ambush, and seize upon the city: for the LORD your God will deliver it into your hand.
verses.web: and you shall rise up from the ambush, and take possession of the city; for LORD your God will deliver it into your hand.
verses.ct: "That's when you spring from your hiding place and take the city. The LORD your God will hand it over to you.

verses.kjv: And it shall be, when ye have taken the city, that ye shall set the city on fire: according to the commandment of the LORD shall ye do. See, I have commanded you.
verses.web: It shall be, when you have seized the city, that you shall set the city on fire. You shall do this according to LORD’s word. Behold, I have commanded you.”
verses.ct: "Once you've captured it, set the city on fire. These are the LORD's instructions. Do exactly as I've told you."

verses.kjv: Joshua therefore sent them forth: and they went to lie in ambush, and abode between Bethel and Ai, on the west side of Ai: but Joshua lodged that night among the people.
verses.web: Joshua sent them out; and they went to set up the ambush, and stayed between Bethel and Ai on the west side of Ai; but Joshua stayed among the people that night.
verses.ct: Joshua sent them off, and they moved into position for the ambush, hiding between Bethel and Ai on the west side of the city. Joshua himself spent that night with the main army.

verses.kjv: And Joshua rose up early in the morning, and numbered the people, and went up, he and the elders of Israel, before the people to Ai.
verses.web: Joshua rose up early in the morning, mustered the people, and went up, he and the elders of Israel, before the people to Ai.
verses.ct: Early the next morning, Joshua assembled the troops and marched toward Ai with the elders of Israel leading the way.

verses.kjv: And all the people, even the people of war that were with him, went up, and drew nigh, and came before the city, and pitched on the north side of Ai: now there was a valley between them and Ai.
verses.web: All the people, even the men of war who were with him, went up and came near, and came before the city and encamped on the north side of Ai. Now there was a valley between him and Ai.
verses.ct: The entire fighting force advanced with him, approaching the city and setting up camp on the north side of Ai, with a valley between them and the city.

verses.kjv: And he took about five thousand men, and set them to lie in ambush between Bethel and Ai, on the west side of the city.
verses.web: He took about five thousand men, and set them in ambush between Bethel and Ai, on the west side of the city.
verses.ct: Joshua had also positioned about 5,000 men in ambush between Bethel and Ai, on the west side of the city.

verses.kjv: And when they had set the people, even all the host that was on the north of the city, and their liers in wait on the west of the city, Joshua went that night into the midst of the valley.
verses.web: So they set the people, even all the army who was on the north of the city, and their ambush on the west of the city; and Joshua went that night into the middle of the valley.
verses.ct: So the army was in place — the main force camped to the north and the ambush hidden to the west. That night, Joshua went down into the valley.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when the king of Ai saw it, that they hasted and rose up early, and the men of the city went out against Israel to battle, he and all his people, at a time appointed, before the plain; but he wist not that there were liers in ambush against him behind the city.
verses.web: When the king of Ai saw it, they hurried and rose up early, and the men of the city went out against Israel to battle, he and all his people, at the time appointed, before the Arabah; but he didn’t know that there was an ambush against him behind the city.
verses.ct: When the king of Ai spotted the Israelites, he and all his men rushed out early to attack them at the designated meeting point near the plain. He had no idea that an ambush was waiting behind the city.

verses.kjv: And Joshua and all Israel made as if they were beaten before them, and fled by the way of the wilderness.
verses.web: Joshua and all Israel made as if they were beaten before them, and fled by the way of the wilderness.
verses.ct: Joshua and the Israelites pretended to be defeated and retreated toward the wilderness.

verses.kjv: And all the people that were in Ai were called together to pursue after them: and they pursued after Joshua, and were drawn away from the city.
verses.web: All the people who were in the city were called together to pursue after them. They pursued Joshua, and were drawn away from the city.
verses.ct: Every soldier in Ai was called out to chase them. They pursued Joshua and were lured farther and farther from the city.

verses.kjv: And there was not a man left in Ai or Bethel, that went not out after Israel: and they left the city open, and pursued after Israel.
verses.web: There was not a man left in Ai or Bethel who didn’t go out after Israel. They left the city open, and pursued Israel.
verses.ct: Not a single man was left in Ai or Bethel — every one of them had gone after Israel. They left the city wide open and undefended.

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto Joshua, Stretch out the spear that is in thy hand toward Ai; for I will give it into thine hand. And Joshua stretched out the spear that he had in his hand toward the city.
verses.web: LORD said to Joshua, “Stretch out the javelin that is in your hand toward Ai, for I will give it into your hand.” Joshua stretched out the javelin that was in his hand toward the city.
verses.ct: Then the LORD said to Joshua, "Raise the spear in your hand and point it toward Ai, because I'm giving the city to you." Joshua raised his spear toward the city.

verses.kjv: And the ambush arose quickly out of their place, and they ran as soon as he had stretched out his hand: and they entered into the city, and took it, and hasted and set the city on fire.
verses.web: The ambush arose quickly out of their place, and they ran as soon as he had stretched out his hand and entered into the city and took it. They hurried and set the city on fire.
verses.ct: The moment he stretched out his hand, the men in ambush sprang from their positions and sprinted into the city. They captured it and immediately set it on fire.

verses.kjv: And when the men of Ai looked behind them, they saw, and, behold, the smoke of the city ascended up to heaven, and they had no power to flee this way or that way: and the people that fled to the wilderness turned back upon the pursuers.
verses.web: When the men of Ai looked behind them, they saw, and behold, the smoke of the city ascended up to heaven, and they had no power to flee this way or that way. The people who fled to the wilderness turned back on the pursuers.
verses.ct: When the men of Ai looked back, they saw smoke billowing up to the sky from their city. They were trapped — there was nowhere to run. Meanwhile, the Israelites who had been fleeing toward the wilderness turned around and charged their pursuers.

verses.kjv: And when Joshua and all Israel saw that the ambush had taken the city, and that the smoke of the city ascended, then they turned again, and slew the men of Ai.
verses.web: When Joshua and all Israel saw that the ambush had taken the city, and that the smoke of the city ascended, then they turned back and killed the men of Ai.
verses.ct: When Joshua and the main force saw smoke rising from the city, they knew the ambush had succeeded. They wheeled around and attacked the men of Ai.

verses.kjv: And the other issued out of the city against them; so they were in the midst of Israel, some on this side, and some on that side: and they smote them, so that they let none of them remain or escape.
verses.web: The others came out of the city against them, so they were in the middle of Israel, some on this side, and some on that side. They struck them, so that they let none of them remain or escape.
verses.ct: At the same time, the Israelites inside the city came out to join the fight. The men of Ai were caught in the middle, with Israelites closing in from both sides. Israel cut them down, leaving no survivors and no one to escape.

verses.kjv: And the king of Ai they took alive, and brought him to Joshua.
verses.web: They captured the king of Ai alive, and brought him to Joshua.
verses.ct: But they captured the king of Ai alive and brought him to Joshua.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when Israel had made an end of slaying all the inhabitants of Ai in the field, in the wilderness wherein they chased them, and when they were all fallen on the edge of the sword, until they were consumed, that all the Israelites returned unto Ai, and smote it with the edge of the sword.
verses.web: When Israel had finished killing all the inhabitants of Ai in the field, in the wilderness in which they pursued them, and they had all fallen by the edge of the sword until they were consumed, all Israel returned to Ai and struck it with the edge of the sword.
verses.ct: After Israel had finished killing every soldier from Ai who had chased them into the open fields and wilderness — striking them all down with the sword until none were left — the entire army returned to Ai and put the rest of the city to the sword.

verses.kjv: And so it was, that all that fell that day, both of men and women, were twelve thousand, even all the men of Ai.
verses.web: All that fell that day, both of men and women, were twelve thousand, even all the people of Ai.
verses.ct: The total number killed that day — men and women — was 12,000, the entire population of Ai.

verses.kjv: For Joshua drew not his hand back, wherewith he stretched out the spear, until he had utterly destroyed all the inhabitants of Ai.
verses.web: For Joshua didn’t draw back his hand, with which he stretched out the javelin, until he had utterly destroyed all the inhabitants of Ai.
verses.ct: Joshua never lowered the spear he held outstretched until every inhabitant of Ai had been completely destroyed.

verses.kjv: Only the cattle and the spoil of that city Israel took for a prey unto themselves, according unto the word of the LORD which he commanded Joshua.
verses.web: Israel took for themselves only the livestock and the goods of that city, according to LORD’s word which he commanded Joshua.
verses.ct: Israel kept only the livestock and plunder from the city for themselves, just as the LORD had instructed Joshua.

verses.kjv: And Joshua burnt Ai, and made it an heap for ever, even a desolation unto this day.
verses.web: So Joshua burned Ai and made it a heap forever, even a desolation, to this day.
verses.ct: Joshua burned Ai to the ground and turned it into a permanent ruin — a desolate heap that remains to this day.

verses.kjv: And the king of Ai he hanged on a tree until eventide: and as soon as the sun was down, Joshua commanded that they should take his carcase down from the tree, and cast it at the entering of the gate of the city, and raise thereon a great heap of stones, that remaineth unto this day.
verses.web: He hanged the king of Ai on a tree until the evening. At sundown, Joshua commanded, and they took his body down from the tree and threw it at the entrance of the gate of the city, and raised a great heap of stones on it that remains to this day.
verses.ct: He had the king of Ai hanged on a tree, leaving his body there until evening. At sunset, Joshua ordered the body taken down and thrown at the entrance of the city gate. They piled a large mound of stones over it, which is still there to this day.

verses.kjv: Then Joshua built an altar unto the LORD God of Israel in mount Ebal,
verses.web: Then Joshua built an altar to LORD, the God of Israel, on Mount Ebal,
verses.ct: Then Joshua built an altar to the LORD, the God of Israel, on Mount Ebal.

verses.kjv: As Moses the servant of the LORD commanded the children of Israel, as it is written in the book of the law of Moses, an altar of whole stones, over which no man hath lift up any iron: and they offered thereon burnt offerings unto the LORD, and sacrificed peace offerings.
verses.web: as Moses the servant of LORD commanded the children of Israel, as it is written in the book of the law of Moses: an altar of uncut stones, on which no one had lifted up any iron. They offered burnt offerings on it to LORD and sacrificed peace offerings.
verses.ct: He built it exactly as Moses, the servant of the LORD, had commanded the people of Israel — following what was written in the Book of the Law of Moses: an altar of uncut stones that no iron tool had ever touched. On it they offered burnt offerings to the LORD and sacrificed peace offerings.

verses.kjv: And he wrote there upon the stones a copy of the law of Moses, which he wrote in the presence of the children of Israel.
verses.web: He wrote there on the stones a copy of Moses’ law, which he wrote in the presence of the children of Israel.
verses.ct: There, in front of all the Israelites, Joshua carved a copy of the Law of Moses onto the stones.

verses.kjv: And all Israel, and their elders, and officers, and their judges, stood on this side the ark and on that side before the priests the Levites, which bare the ark of the covenant of the LORD, as well the stranger, as he that was born among them; half of them over against mount Gerizim, and half of them over against mount Ebal; as Moses the servant of the LORD had commanded before, that they should bless the people of Israel.
verses.web: All Israel, with their elders, officers, and judges, stood on both sides of the ark before the Levitical priests, who carried the ark of LORD’s covenant, the foreigner as well as the native; half of them in front of Mount Gerizim, and half of them in front of Mount Ebal, as Moses the servant of LORD had commanded at the first, that they should bless the people of Israel.
verses.ct: All Israel — their elders, officers, and judges — stood on both sides of the ark, facing the Levitical priests who carried the ark of the LORD's covenant. Foreigners and native-born Israelites alike were there. Half the people stood facing Mount Gerizim and half facing Mount Ebal, just as Moses the servant of the LORD had originally commanded for the blessing of the people of Israel.

verses.kjv: And afterward he read all the words of the law, the blessings and cursings, according to all that is written in the book of the law.
verses.web: Afterward he read all the words of the law, the blessing and the curse, according to all that is written in the book of the law.
verses.ct: After that, Joshua read aloud every word of the Law — both the blessings and the curses — exactly as they were written in the Book of the Law.

verses.kjv: There was not a word of all that Moses commanded, which Joshua read not before all the congregation of Israel, with the women, and the little ones, and the strangers that were conversant among them.
verses.web: There was not a word of all that Moses commanded which Joshua didn’t read before all the assembly of Israel, with the women, the little ones, and the foreigners who were among them.
verses.ct: Joshua didn't skip a single word of everything Moses had commanded. He read it all before the entire assembly of Israel — including the women, the children, and the foreigners living among them.
